doc:
Miriam Wolfe https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miriam_Wolfe 0 Miriam Wolfe (January 2, 1922 – September 29, 2000) was an American actress, director, producer and writer, who worked in theatre, television and radio from the 1920s to the 1950s. She is mainly remembered for her character roles on radio's weekly Let's Pretend. She was born Miriam Wolff in Brooklyn, New York on January 2, 1922 to Belarusian and Ukrainian immigrant parents. She made her professional acting debut at age four, reciting poems and reading stories on The Uncle Gee Bee Kiddie Hour on WGBS, one of New York's first radio stations. Miriam_Wolfe ( January_2_,_1922 – September_29_,_2000 ) was an_American_actress , director , producer_and_writer , who worked in theatre_,_television_and_radio from the_1920s to the_1950s . She is_mainly_remembered for her_character_roles on radio 's_weekly_Let 's Pretend . She made her_professional_acting_debut at age_four , reciting poems and reading stories on The_Uncle_Gee_Bee_Kiddie_Hour on WGBS , one of New_York 's_first_radio_stations .
